channel.title: ENV110 - Environmental Sciences on
channel.description: Recent content in ENV110 - Environmental Sciences on

item.title: Tornados
item.description: A tornado is a violently rotating column of air extending downwards from a cumulonimbus - deep convection - cloud. Tornados can range from a few meters to over 4 kilometers in diameter and can last anywhere from a few seconds to tens of minutes.

item.title: Tropical Cyclones
item.description: Tropical Cyclones are rotating storm systems which originate over warm, tropical waters. Energy Source Tropical cyclones are powered by the latent heat of condensation.

item.title: Orographic Lifting
item.description: Oro means “mountain” Orographic lifting occurs when air is forced to ascend upslope as it is pushed against a mountain.
